title: Mapping Italian News Research Program - UniUrb
snippet: Mentions Fabio Giglietto as co-author of the white paper "The State of Social Media Research APIs & Tool in the DSA Era" exploring the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on data access for platform research. It also mentions a workshop on health, religion and disinformation hosted by the University of Urbino.
description: This news item from the University of Urbino website mentions Fabio Giglietto as a co-author of a white paper exploring the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on data access for platform research. It also mentions a workshop on health, religion and disinformation hosted by the University of Urbino.

title: Integrating Large Language Models in Political Discourse Studies on Social Media: Challenges of Validating an LLMs-in-the-loop Pipeline | Sociologica
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is mentioned as an Associate Professor of Internet Studies at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, whose research explores the relationship between information theory, media, and digital technologies. He is also described as employing computational methods to analyze online information dissemination and media manipulation.
description: The Sociologica article discusses the integration of large language models in political discourse studies on social media. Fabio Giglietto is mentioned as an Associate Professor at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo whose research explores the intersection of information theory, media, and digital technologies, using computational methods to analyze online information dissemination and media manipulation.

Meta Is Getting Rid of CrowdTangle — and Its Replacement Isn't As Transparent or Accessible - Proof News
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, an associate professor of internet studies at the University of Urbino, is quoted regarding Meta's MCL (Meta Content Library) and its limitations compared to CrowdTangle, particularly concerning data exporting and its impact on disinformation research projects like Vera AI EU.
description: The article discusses Meta's decision to retire CrowdTangle and replace it with MCL, and Fabio Giglietto is quoted on the limitations of MCL for disinformation research.

title: Who is behind vera.ai? Meet the people and teams that make up the vera.ai project. #8 Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: An interview with Fabio Giglietto and his team at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo about their work on the vera.ai project, which focuses on detecting coordinated sharing behavior and combating disinformation.
description: This is an interview with Fabio Giglietto and his team at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo discussing their involvement with the vera.ai project, which aims to detect coordinated disinformation sharing.
